intro: Caucalis tuberculata, commonly known as the woolly mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Caucalis tuberculata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
